technology.name: tech

tag: ------span;v:Specializing in artificial intelligence processors and artificial intelligence systems, we have been incubated at Georgia Institute of Technology in the US, build a collaborative system, and are co-developing with global AI Transformer and Fintech Data Centers companies in Europe and North America. We design semiconductor chips and system software.
------span;v:SOTERIA is the future technology that serves the vision of a happier, more enriched humanity.
------span;v:Semiconductor Technologies with Artificial Intelligence to Develop Innovative Products and Solutions
------span;v:We specialize in designing system semiconductors needed by fabless, chipless, and DSP manufacturers and companies.

------span;v:We specialize in designing system semiconductors needed by fabless, chipless, and DSP manufacturers and companies. It provides various values of digital artificial intelligence hardware from systems, connected IT services, and security fields.
-------span;v:soteria is global fabless semiconductor company that provides AI-based intelligent response solutions

S. Baek, H. Lee, C.A.Nicopoulos, J. Lee, and J. Kim, "Size-aware Cache Management for High-Performance Compressed Caching", in IEEE Transactions on Computers (TC), Vol. 64, pp. 2337-2352.
S. Baek, H. Lee, C.A. Nicopoulos, and J. Kim, “Designing Hybrid DRAM/PCM Main Memory Systems Utilizing Dual-Phase Compression”, in ACM Transactions on Design Automation Electronic Systems (TODAES).

N. Jammula, M. Qureshi, A. Gavrilovska, and J. Kim, “Balancing Context Switch Penalty and Response Time with Elastic Time Slicing”, in Proc. the 21st International Conference on High Performance Computing (HiPC), Goa, India. [Best Paper Award]
S. Kang, C. Nicopoulos, H. Lee, and J. Kim, “A High-Performance and Energy-Efficient Virtually Tagged Stack Cache Architecture for Multi-Core Environments”, in Proc. the 13th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC 2011), [Best Paper Award out of 271 papers submitted] pp. 58-67.
